info.prompt: You are a data miner that deals with scientific texts on microbiology and you extract numerical values related with antimicrobial effect. For the text I will input next, output only the numbers associated with minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values indicating the antimicrobial effect. Output the concentration unit (ex: mg L-1) with a blank space after each number found (Ex: '10.1 mg L-1' or '10.1 mg mL-1' or '10.1 g mL-1' or '10.1 ug mL-1'). If no value is found, output 'None'. Do not output concentration values not related with minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC).

('ATC03887', 0).text: The minimum inhibitory concentration value of the TiO2 nanoparticles was found to be 62.50 ug ml-1 for both the bacterial strains.

('ATC04091', 0).text: Furthermore, ZnO/MWCNTs indicated the least MIC values of 0.01, 0.001 mg mL-1, and MBC values of 0.01, 0.001 mg mL-1 against E.coli and S. aureus respectively.

('ATC04241', 0).text: The minimum inhibitory concentrations (MIC) were determined as 500 mg L-1, 350 mg L-1 and 200 mg L-1 against bacteria, respectively.

('ATC05202', 0).text: The antimicrobial activity of ZnO@Ag was proved by the microbroth dilution method, and the minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs) of S. aureus, E. coli, and V. parahemolyticus were 40, 50, and 55 ug mL-1, respectively.
('ATC05202', 0).extracted val: 40 ug mL-1, 50 ug mL-1, 55 ug mL-1

('ATC06670', 0).text: The nanocomposite presented excellent antibacterial activities against both Gram-negative (Escherichia coli) and Gram-positive (Staphylococcus aureus) bacteria, with respective minimum inhibitory concentration as 40 and 60 ug mL-1, respectively.

('ATC10232', 0).text: Based on the evaluation of the growth curve, PLGA/MUP NPs inhibited growth of the both tested strains already at a concentration of 0.29 ug ml-1, and their inhibitory effect at concentrations from 0.29 to 1.17 ug ml-1 was comparable with free MUP using the disk-diffusion method.

('ATC10890', 1).text: Additionally, a time-kill curve analysis was performed and for ternary nanocomposite; the killing response was most effective as the complete killing was achieved at 3 h of incubation at 3-MIC (9.75 ug mL-1.

('ATC11532', 0).text: The nanocomposite displayed broad-range antimicrobial potential against the test pathogens, with minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs) ranging between 31.25 and 125.0 ug mL-1, and biofilm inhibition up to 80 - 96 %.

('ATC11894', 0).text: In addition, appropriate antifungal effects with the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values of 18.75, 37.5, and 75 ug mL-1 against Candida krusei, Candida glabrata, and Candida albicans, respectively, were noted for this new bionanomaterial.

('ATC13841', 0).text: As a result, it emerged that ZnO nanoparticles synthesized from hybrid Verbascum x calcicolum were effective on gram-positive bacteria and gram-negative bacteria such as Staphylococcus aureus (MIC = 160 mg ml-1 for VcZnO), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC = 80 mg ml-1 for VcZnO), Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC = 40 mg ml-1 for VcZnO and, MIC = 120 mg ml-1 for VcSe), Escherichia coli (MIC = 20 mg ml-1 for VcZnO).
('ATC13841', 0).extracted val: 160 mg ml-1, 80 mg ml-1, 40 mg ml-1, 120 mg ml-1, 20 mg ml-1

('ATC14126', 0).text: Minimum inhibitory concentration in ug mL-1 of silver nanoparticles was found to be as low as 33.3 for resistant Streptococcus haemolyticus; 11.1 for Staphylococcus aureus and E Coli; and 3.7 ug mL-1 for resistant Pseudomonas aeruginosa.

('ATC21005', 0).text: The MIC and MBC values of the nanocomposite were measured as 256 and 512 ug mL-1, respectively.

('ATC21235', 0).text: Collected samples were directly cultivated on MacConkey agar with cefotaxime (2 mg l-1, whereas intestinal swabs of slaughtered pigs and surface swabs from pig carcasses were also pre-enriched in buffered peptone water without antimicrobials before the cultivation.

('ATC22673', 0).text: The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of PLA/CEO/beta-CD nanofilm against Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus was approximately 1 mg ml-1 (corresponding CEO concentration 11.35 ug ml-1 and minimum bactericidal concentration (MBC) was approximately 7 mg ml-1 (corresponding CEO concentration 79.45 ug ml-1.

('ATC27876', 0).text: In addition, CEO-CSNPs showed a minimum inhibitory concentration against Staphylococcus aureus, Salmonella infantis and Escherichia coli of 5.29, 10.57 and 10.57 ug mL-1, respectively.

('ATC28097', 0).text: The synthesized CdS nanoparticles exhibited potent activity (MIC = > 256 ug ml-1 against the MRSA (ATCC 4330).

('ATC28751', 2).text: Ability of biofilm formation was dramatically reduced by 1/4 MIC concentration (2 ug mL-1 against the CRAB and 1/2 MIC concentration (2 ug mL-1 in the case of the MRSA isolates.

('ATC29342', 0).text: Minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of MnWO4 nanoflowers was found to be 10 ug ml-1.

('ATC34359', 0).text: From minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) results, it was observed that WARDEEP exhibited a strong antibiotic activity against Proteus and Streptococcus species at a least value of 12.5 mg mL-1 concentration.

('ATC43677', 0).text: It was determined that whereas the ligand indicated modest antimicrobial activity against Staphylococcus aureus and Candida albicans at a concentration of 6.25 ug ml-1, the palladium complex was significantly effective against C. albicans at a concentration of 6.25 ug ml-1.

('ATC44254', 0).text: The as-synthesised Ag-NPs show better antibacterial efficacy than the antibiotics; ciproflaxin and imipenem against Pseudomonas aeruginosa with minimum inhibition concentration (MIC) of 6 ug mL-1, and better efficacy than imipenem against Escherichia coli with MIC of 10 ug mL-1.

('ATC47325', 1).text: The MIC and MFC of CaONPs against Candida albicans were 200 ug ml-1 and 250 ug ml-1, respectively.

('ATC48617', 0).text: Polycat@AgNPs showed superior antimicrobial activity to cat@AgNPs and cat-borax@AgNPs as well as citrate@AgNPs, exhibiting MICs of only 1.25 ug mL-1 (Ag) for Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Acinetobacter baumannii.

('ATC52263', 0).text: Antibacterial activity tests indicated a significant enhancement in antibacterial properties, with minimum inhibitory concentrations of 1.5 and 3 mg mL-1 against Acinetobacter baumannii and Staphylococcus aureus, respectively.
